subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: Ending nearly three months of suspense about his future, Heat center Alonzo Mourning said last night at his annual Zo’s Summer Groove charity game in Miami that he would play again next season — a choice he kept secret to the end, insisting he was still deciding just hours before the actual announcement.“I will be coming back,” Mourning said.This was the third straight summer Mourning considered retirement before choosing to keep playing. Next season will be his 15th in the N.B.A., not including a full year he missed with kidney problems that led to a transplant in 2003.
